English.Text: Your diplomat rattles off a fine argument. "What is the more likely? That an army of the dead protect that treasure, or that pirates invented the fable to scare adventurers like us from stealing it?" Galvanized, the crew agree to enter the caves. In this underworld, where day lives in permanent exile, lamps are lit, but die by turns; suffocated by forces ageless and unseen. Your men hesitate to light them again; "the old light burns the eyes of the deathless," a voice whispers, "it will anger them."
